sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Chris Simmons)
articles.description: The power of framework-specific UI libraries, such as Skeleton, can lead to more productivity using the combined ability of Svelte and Tailwind to build modern web-based apps.
articles.title: Meet Skeleton: Svelte + Tailwind For Reactive UIs

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: In this article, the first part of “Databases for Front-end Developers” series, Atila Fassina helps you understand the concepts behind database architecture in order to use them reliably and sheds some light on serverless databases.
articles.title: Databases For Front-End Developers: The Rise Of Serverless Databases (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: Identify, compare, analyze and fix your Core Web Vitals scores to boost web performance of your sites. These tools will help you to do just that.
articles.title: Core Web Vitals Tools To Boost Your Web Performance Scores

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we ask how you can affect change to UX design in large organizations stuck in their ways. Vitaly talks to Marko Dugonjić to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 50 With Marko Dugonjic: Can You Change A UX Dinosaur?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Catherine Houle & Ilknur Eren)
articles.description: In this article, Catherine Houle and Ilknur Eren share how their organization “Understood” removes barriers for people who learn and think differently by combining accessibility and usability in their processes. They also cover basic steps on how to fix common accessibility issues.
articles.title: How Our Organization Improved Web Accessibility (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How to improve authentication UX, with magic links, 2FA, better password recovery and relaxed rules for secure, accessible and usable passwords.
articles.title: Rethinking Authentication UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sam Robbins)
articles.description: We’re going to walk through how to migrate your site from jQuery to [React](/category/React) with [Next.js](/category/next.js). This will help with performance and the maintainability of your code.
articles.title: Migration From jQuery to Next.js: A Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ruslan Yevych)
articles.description: If you like math and CSS, you’ll love this one. We don’t need to use media queries to change the values of some CSS properties — *font-size*, *padding*, *margin* etc. — depending on the viewport width, with the CSS `clamp` function. But: we still need to use media queries for changing colors, borders, shadows and other CSS styles.
articles.title: Fluid Sizing Instead Of Multiple Media Queries?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Do you need a little inspiration boost? Well, then our new batch of desktop wallpapers is for you. Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for August 2022.
articles.title: Memories Of August (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noam Rosenthal)
articles.description: Testing is not just about tools and processes. It’s about architecture. In this article, Noam Rosenthal will share his experience on how to organize testing and find the right balance between front-end and subsystems and between different strategies.
articles.title: Testable Frontend: The Good, The Bad And The Flaky

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Olushuyi Olutimilehin)
articles.description:
In this article, Olushuyi explores a mental model that helps you decide between the `` and `
` elements when writing documents. You will explore how grouping content affects accessibility and how you can make it all count for users.
articles.title: <article> vs. <section>: How To Choose The Right One

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In this article, Luis Ouriach helps to develop your own guiding principles to become a better designer so that you can walk into the design critique meetings with more confidence and really deliver the best representation of your ideas.
articles.title: Overcoming Imposter Syndrome By Developing Your Own Guiding Principles

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jarijn Nijkamp)
articles.description: Now that some time has passed since the team returned from SmashingConf San Francisco, we’ve had time to think about the event and wrap up some of the things we all learned.
articles.title: Looking Back At SmashingConf SF 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Optimizing the size of images can have a bigger impact on performance than all other areas combined. In this article, Louis Lazaris covers different tools available for reducing the size of images.
articles.title: Powerful Image Optimization Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Burel)
articles.description: “Segmented Rendering” is a new pattern and it will change the Jamstack game forever. Let’s try to push the boundaries of static rendering and learn how to apply it to personalized content.
articles.title: A New Pattern For The Jamstack: Segmented Rendering

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Scott Himmer)
articles.description: In this article, Scott Himmer will go over some areas where you might find the design and engineering conflicts manifesting, what some of the contributing factors are, and strategies to work through the challenges.
articles.title: Resolving Conflicts Between Designers And Engineers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Raphael Amoedo)
articles.description: Using only Docker to build and run applications and commands removes the need for previous knowledge in some tool or programming language. Also, it avoids the necessity to install new modules and dependencies directly to the system, which makes development machine-independent.

articles.description: Mit dem Ende des klassischen CentOS sehen sich Cloud-Provider nach einem Nachfolger um. Google entscheidet sich nun für ein speziell angepasstes Rocky Linux.
articles.title: CentOS-Nachfolger: Google Cloud setzt auf Rocky Linux

articles.description: Die Verwaltung von Immobilien ist arbeitsintensiv und komplex. Wir stellen neun Programme vor, die Verwaltungsaufgaben standardisieren und automatisieren.
articles.title: Für Vermieter und Wohnungseigentümer: Hausverwaltungssoftware im Vergleich

articles.description: Die Minor Version erlaubt den Einsatz gewöhnlicher Funktionen als Helper und stellt einen neuen Test Helper steht zur Verfügung. Ember 4.4 wird zum LTS-Release.
articles.title: Webframework: Ember 4.5 verwandelt Funktionen in Helper

articles.description: Wer programmieren kann, hat die Qual der Wahl: In Deutschland sind 155.000 Stellen frei. Am gefragtesten sind dabei Java, SQL, Python – vor allem in Berlin.
articles.title: IT-Fachkräftemangel: Für welche Programmiersprachen ist der Bedarf am höchsten?

articles.description: In VMwares vCenter Server und der Cloud Foundation klafft eine Sicherheitslücke in der Integrated Windows Authentication. Nun gibt es ein Software-Update.
articles.title: Lücke in VMware vCenter Server und Cloud Foundation zum Teil abgedichtet

articles.description: Google erklärt die Gründe für das Ende der internen Linux-Distribution Goobuntu, wie man das neue gLinux verwaltet und warum man Rolling Releases bevorzugt.
articles.title: Google: Warum uns Ubuntu zu träge war – und wie wir jetzt gLinux administrieren

articles.description: Am 17. Juli endet die Very-Early-Bird-Aktion, der besondere Frühbucherrabatt zur Speicherkonferenz storage2day. Das Event startet am 13. Oktober in München.
articles.title: heise-Angebot: storage2day: Letzte Chance für richtig frühe Vögel

articles.description: 30.000 E-Rezepte sind eingelöst und abgerechnet worden. Das ist ein wichtiger Meilenstein für die Gematik GmbH, die nationale Agentur für digitale Medizin.
articles.title: Meilenstein: 30.000 elektronische Rezepte abgerechnet

articles.description: heise Developer präsentiert den Videocast von Eberhard Wolff und Lisa Moritz: Erneut geht es um die Rolle des Softwarearchitekten und der Softwarearchitektin.
articles.title: software-architektur.tv: Die Rolle der Softwarearchitekten, Teil 2

articles.description: Bevor in den nächsten Wochen Android 13 erscheinen soll, können Developer ihre Apps mit der vierten Beta auf der neuen Version des Betriebssystems testen.
articles.title: Android 13: Letzte Beta bereitet auf Release vor

articles.description: An vier Terminen im August lernen Webentwickler alles, was man braucht, um mit Node.js durchzustarten. Jetzt verlosen wir 5 Tickets für die Webinar-Serie.
articles.title: heise-Angebot: Node.js in vier Wochen: 5 Tickets im Wert von je 495 Euro zu gewinnen

articles.description: Apple nutzt mittlerweile standardmäßig HEIF/HEIC und HEVC. Will man die weitergeben, kann es Probleme geben. Ein Gratis-Tool hilft.
articles.title: App wandelt iPhone-Formate für PC- und Android-Freunde

articles.description: Hunter Bidens Fotos, Kommunikation und andere Daten aus Apple-Diensten sind wohl im Internet. Der Secret Service ist informiert.
articles.title: iCloud-Account von US-Präsidentensohn Hunter Biden offenbar gehackt

articles.description: Mit der Verkettung zweier Security-Bugs in der Groupware haben Angreifer seit Ende Juni tausende Zimbra-Installationen übernommen.
articles.title: Groupware Zimbra "trivial angreifbar" – Admins sollten schnell updaten

articles.description: Zoho hat Updates veröffentlicht, die eine kritische und weitere Sicherheitslücken in ManageEngine OpManager schließen. Angreifer könnten unbefugt zugreifen.
articles.title: Kritische Sicherheitslücke in Zoho ManageEngine OpManager

articles.description: Der Netzwerkausrüster Cisco schließt mit aktualisierter Software eine Sicherheitslücke in ASA und Firepower. Angreifer könnten private RSA-Keys auslesen.
articles.title: Cisco: Angreifer könnten an private RSA-Schlüssel in ASA und Firepower gelangen

articles.description: Das  HomeTec Pro CFA3000 und die dazugehörige Fernbedienung sind unsicher, warnt das BSI. Unbefugte könnten das Schloss entriegeln.
articles.title: BSI warnt vor unsicherem Funk-Türschloss von Abus

articles.description: VMware hat für neu entdeckte Sicherheitslücken Updates bereitgestellt. Für eine ältere Schwachstelle ist jetzt Exploit-Code aufgetaucht, warnt der Hersteller.
articles.title: Jetzt handeln! Exploit-Code für VMware-Lücke aufgetaucht, neue Updates verfügbar

articles.description: Im August veröffentlicht SAP Meldungen zu fünf neu entdeckten Sicherheitslücken. Zudem aktualisiert der Hersteller zwei ältere Berichte zu Schwachstellen.
articles.title: Patchday: SAP schließt fünf Sicherheitslücken

articles.description: Adobe schließt zum August-Patchday mehrere, teils kritische Sicherheitslücken. Betroffen sind Adobe Commerce und Magento sowie PDF- und Kreativ-Software.
articles.title: Patchday: Adobe schließt kritische Lücken in Commerce und Kreativprogrammen

articles.description: 121 Schwachstellen wurden im großen Produktportfolio von Microsoft zum August-Patchday gefunden. Eine davon wird bereits von Cyberkriminellen missbraucht.
articles.title: Patchday: Microsoft dichtet Zero-Day-Lücke und 120 weitere Sicherheitslecks ab

articles.description: Eine Schwachstelle in den Routern von DrayTek ermöglicht Angreifern aus dem Netz die Kompromittierung der Geräte. Nicht einmal eine Anmeldung ist dafür nötig.
articles.title: Übernahme möglich: DrayTek-Router mit kritischer Sicherheitslücke

articles.description: Die Version 104 der Webbrowser Chrome und Edge dichten zahlreiche Sicherheitslecks ab. Einige Features von Chrome haben zudem eine Politur erfahren.
articles.title: Webbrowser: Google Chrome und Microsoft Edge 104 schließen Sicherheitslücken

articles.title: Patchday: F5 dichtet Schwachstellen in BIG IP und Nginx ab

articles.description: Admin-Zugang ohne Passwort – und das ist nur eine der zehn Lücken, für die VMware dringliche Updates bringt.
articles.title: VMware-Updates: Schnelles Handeln "extrem wichtig"

articles.description: Das Web-Interface der Cisco-Router der RV-Serie ermöglicht diverse unauthentifizierte Aktionen – Updates stellen das ab.
articles.title: Kritische Lücken in Ciscos SMB-Routern

articles.description: Die angekündigte neue rsync-Version soll verhindern, dass ein Server gezielt Dateien auf dem Client überschreibt und diesen damit kompromittiert.
articles.title: Kopieren mit rsync anfällig für Angriffe

articles.description: Entwicklungsumgebungen mit bestimmten Plug-ins für Jenkins sind verwundbar. Bislang sind noch nicht für alle Sicherheitspatches erschienen.
articles.title: Softwareerstellung: Einige Jenkins-Plug-ins werden abgesichert, andere nicht

articles.title: Sicherheitslücken als Türöffner in Nuki Smart Lock entdeckt und geschlossen

articles.description: Die Entwickler von Mozilla haben im E-Mail-Client Thunderbird mehrere Sicherheitslücken geschlossen.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdates: Schadcode-Attacken auf Thunderbird vorstellbar

articles.description: Wer PDF-Anwendungen von Foxit nutzt, sollte aus Sicherheitsgründen sicherstellen, dass die Software auf dem aktuellen Stand ist.
articles.title: Foxit PDF Reader und Editor unter macOS und Windows angreifbar

articles.description: Ein wichtiges Sicherheitsupdate schließt eine Schwachstelle in McAfee Agent.
articles.title: McAfee Agent könnte als Schlupfloch für Schadcode dienen

articles.description: Angreifer könnten an einer Sicherheitslücke in Windows-Schutzlösungen von Trend Micro ansetzen.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdate: Trend Micro Apex One und Worry-Free Business angreifbar

articles.description: Nachdem ein Standard-Passwort auf  Social-Media-Plattformen aufgetaucht ist, nehmen Angreifer Confluence ins Visier. Aber nicht alle Instanzen sind verwundbar.
articles.title: Jetzt patchen! Attacken auf Atlassian Confluence

articles.description: Die Entwickler haben in aktuellen Versionen der Backuplösung NetBackup von Veritas unter anderem kritische Lücken geschlossen.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdates: Angreifer könnten Veritas NetBackup vielfältig attackieren

articles.description: Es gibt wichtige Sicherheitsupdates für unter anderem IBM Rational ClearCase und QRadar SIEM: Die kritischen Lücken liegen in der XML-Parser-Bibliothek Expat.
articles.title: IBM-Software: Kritische Lücke könnte Schadcode in Entwicklungsumgebungen lassen

articles.description: Das freie Programmpaket Samba ist über fünf Sicherheitslücken attackierbar. Sicherheitspatches sind verfügbar.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdates Samba: Angreifer könnten Admin-Passwörter ändern

articles.description: Die Entwickler haben das freie Office-Paket LibreOffice gegen mögliche Attacken abgesichert und insgesamt drei Sicherheitslücken geschlossen.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdates: LibreOffice könnte Passwörter für Web-Zugriffe leaken

articles.description: Online-Shop-Betreiber auf PrestaShop-Basis sollten die Software zur Wahrung der Kundensicherheit auf den aktuellen Stand bringen.
articles.title: Shop-System: Angreifer kopieren Kreditkarten-Daten aus PrestaShop-Websites

articles.description: Owl Labs hat seine Geräte mit zusätzlichen Sicherheitsupdates gegen mögliche Attacken abgesichert.
articles.title: Weitere Lücken in Videokonferenz-Hardware Meeting Owl geschlossen

articles.description: Patches schließen mehrere Lücken in Sicherheitsprodukten von WithSecure ehemals F-Secure.
articles.title: Angreifer könnten Scan-Engine von F-Secure und WithSecure crashen lassen

articles.description: Angreifer könnten an einer kritischen Sicherheitslücke in Sonicwall Global Management System und Analytics On-Prem ansetzen.
articles.title: Sicherheitspatch: Sonicwall-Software für SQL-Injection-Attacken anfällig

articles.description: Es gibt wichtige Sicherheitsupdates für IBM Security Access Manager und Security Guardium Insights.
articles.title: Angreifer könnten Backend-Datenbank von IBM Security Access Manager manipulieren

articles.description: Angreifer könnten den Webbrowser Chrome mit Schadcode attackieren.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdate: Elf Sicherheitsprobleme in Google Chrome gelöst

articles.description: Es gibt wichtige Sicherheitsupdates für Hard- und Software vom Netzwerkausrüster Cisco.
articles.title: Schadcode-Attacken mit Root-Rechten auf Cisco Nexus Dashboard möglich

articles.description: Unter bestimmten Voraussetzungen könnten Angreifer Atlassian Confluence Server und Data Center attackieren. Das Sicherheitsrisiko gilt als kritisch.
articles.title: Nutzer-Account mit Standard-Passwort gefährdet Atlassian Confluence

articles.description: Mehrere Firewall-Modelle von Zyxel sind über Sicherheitslücken attackierbar.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdates: Root-Lücke bedroht Zyxel-Firewalls

articles.description: Wichtige Sicherheitspatches schließen unter anderem kritische Lücken in Oracle-Anwendungen.
articles.title: Jetzt patchen! Oracle sichert seine Produkte mit 349 Updates ab

articles.description: Der Netzwerkausrüster Juniper hat unter anderem in Contrail Networking kritische Sicherheitslücken geschlossen.
articles.title: Sicherheitsupdates: Angreifer könnten Juniper-Software mit Schadcode attackieren

articles.description: In VMwares vCenter Server und der Cloud Foundation klafft eine Sicherheitslücke in der Integrated Windows Authentication. Nun gibt es ein Software-Update.
articles.title: Lücke in VMware vCenter Server und Cloud Foundation zum Teil abgedichtet

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Security flaws have been identified in Xiaomi Redmi Note 9T and Redmi Note 11 models, which could be exploited to disable the mobile payment mechanism and even forge transactions via a rogue Android app installed on the devices.
Check Point said it found the flaws in devices powered by MediaTek chipsets during a security analysis of the Chinese handset maker's "Kinibi" Trusted Execution
articles.title: Xiaomi Phones with MediaTek Chips Found Vulnerable to Forged Payments

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Social media company Meta said it will begin testing end-to-end encryption (E2EE) on its Messenger platform this week for select users as the default option, as the company continues to slowly add security layers to its various chat services.
"If you're in the test group, some of your most frequent chats may be automatically end-to-end encrypted, which means you won't have to opt in to the
articles.title: Facebook Testing Default End-to-End Encryption and Encrypted Backups in Messenger

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
The U.S. State Department on Thursday announced a $10 million reward for information related to five individuals associated with the Conti ransomware group.
The reward offer, first reported by WIRED, is also notable for the fact that it marks the first time the face of a Conti associate, known as "Target," has been unmasked. The four other associates have been referred to as "Tramp," "Dandis," "
articles.title: U.S. Government Offers $10 Million Reward for Information on Conti Ransomware Gang

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Cisco on Wednesday released patches to contain multiple flaws in its software that could be abused to leak sensitive information on susceptible appliances.
The issue, assigned the identifier CVE-2022-20866 (CVSS score: 7.4), has been described as a "logic error" when handling RSA keys on devices running Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD)
articles.title: Cisco Patches High-Severity Vulnerability Affecting ASA and Firepower Solutions

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (The Hacker News)
articles.description: Back when the internet consisted of a handful of computers networked together across a few research institutions, nobody could have imagined that it would one day form the backbone of a new digital way of life. And that probably explains why none of the researchers who thought up its core technologies — things like packet switching and TCP/IP — gave much consideration to the need to secure the
articles.title: Fast and Secure VPN on a Budget? Private Internet Access VPN Has You Covered

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Thursday added two flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog, citing evidence of active exploitation.
The two high-severity issues relate to weaknesses in Zimbra Collaboration, both of which could be chained to achieve unauthenticated remote code execution on affected email servers -

CVE-2022-27925 (CVSS score: 7.2)
articles.title: Researchers Warn of Ongoing Mass Exploitation of Zimbra RCE Vulnerability

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Three different offshoots of the notorious Conti cybercrime cartel have resorted to the technique of call-back phishing as an initial access vector to breach targeted networks.
"Three autonomous threat groups have since adopted and independently developed their own targeted phishing tactics derived from the call back phishing methodology," cybersecurity firm AdvIntel said in a Wednesday report.
articles.title: Conti Cybercrime Cartel Using 'BazarCall' Phishing Attacks as Initial Attack Vector

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Networking equipment major Cisco on Wednesday confirmed it was the victim of a cyberattack on May 24, 2022 after the attackers got hold of an employee's personal Google account that contained passwords synced from their web browser.
"Initial access to the Cisco VPN was achieved via the successful compromise of a Cisco employee's personal Google account," Cisco Talos said in a detailed write-up.
articles.title: Cisco Confirms It's Been Hacked by Yanluowang Ransomware Gang

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Threat actors associated with the Cuba ransomware have been linked to previously undocumented tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs), including a new remote access trojan called ROMCOM RAT on compromised systems.
The new findings come from Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 threat intelligence team, which is tracking the double extortion ransomware group under the constellation-themed moniker
articles.title: Hackers Behind Cuba Ransomware Attacks Using New RAT Malware

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (The Hacker News)
articles.description: Password security is only as strong as the password itself. Unfortunately, we are often reminded of the danger of weak, reused, and compromised passwords with major cybersecurity breaches that start with stolen credentials. For example, in May 2022, the popular wedding planning site, Zola, was the victim of a significant cybersecurity breach where hackers used an attack known as credential
articles.title: What the Zola Hack Can Teach Us About Password Security

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed multiple severe security vulnerabilities asset management platform Device42 that, if successfully exploited, could enable a malicious actor to seize control of affected systems.
"By exploiting these issues, an attacker could impersonate other users, obtain admin-level access in the application (by leaking session with an LFI) or obtain full access to the
articles.title: Critical Flaws Disclosed in Device42 IT Asset Management Software

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Cloud-based code hosting platform GitHub has announced that it will now start sending Dependabot alerts for vulnerable GitHub Actions to help developers fix security issues in CI/CD workflows.
"When a security vulnerability is reported in an action, our team of security researchers will create an advisory to document the vulnerability, which will trigger an alert to impacted repositories,"
articles.title: GitHub Dependabot Now Alerts Developers On Vulnerable GitHub Actions

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
A former Twitter employee has been pronounced guilty for his role in digging up private information pertaining to certain Twitter users and turning over that data to Saudi Arabia.
Ahmad Abouammo, 44, was convicted by a jury after a two-week trial in San Francisco federal court, Bloomberg reported Tuesday. He faces up to 20 years in prison when sentenced.
The verdict comes nearly three years
articles.title: Former Twitter Employee Found Guilty of Spying for Saudi Arabia

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
The first ever incident possibly involving the ransomware family known as Maui occurred on April 15, 2021, aimed at an unnamed Japanese housing company.
The disclosure from Kaspersky arrives a month after U.S. cybersecurity and intelligence agencies issued an advisory about the use of the ransomware strain by North Korean government-backed hackers to target the healthcare sector since at least
articles.title: Experts Uncover Details on Maui Ransomware Attack by North Korean Hackers

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Web infrastructure company Cloudflare on Tuesday disclosed at least 76 employees and their family members received text messages on their personal and work phones bearing similar characteristics as that of the sophisticated phishing attack against Twilio.
The attack, which transpired around the same time Twilio was targeted, came from four phone numbers associated with T-Mobile-issued SIM cards
articles.title: Hackers Behind Twilio Breach Also Targeted Cloudflare Employees

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (The Hacker News)
articles.description:
Today's web has made hackers' tasks remarkably easy. For the most part, hackers don't even have to hide in the dark recesses of the web to take advantage of people any longer; they can be found right in plain sight on social media sites or forums, professionally advertised with their websites, and may even approach you anonymously through such channels as Twitter.
Cybercrime has entered a new
articles.title: The Business of Hackers-for-Hire Threat Actors

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Tuesday added a recently disclosed security flaw in the UnRAR utility to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation.
Tracked as CVE-2022-30333 (CVSS score: 7.5), the issue concerns a path traversal vulnerability in the Unix versions of UnRAR that can be triggered upon extracting a
articles.title: CISA Issues Warning on Active Exploitation of UnRAR Software for Linux Systems

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
As many as 121 new security flaws were patched by Microsoft as part of its Patch Tuesday updates for the month of August, which also includes a fix for a Support Diagnostic Tool vulnerability that the company said is being actively exploited in the wild.
Of the 121 bugs, 17 are rated Critical, 102 are rated Important, one is rated Moderate, and one is rated Low in severity. Two of the issues
articles.title: Microsoft Issues Patches for 121 Flaws, Including Zero-Day Under Active Attack

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Customer engagement platform Twilio on Monday disclosed that a "sophisticated" threat actor gained "unauthorized access" using an SMS-based phishing campaign aimed at its staff to gain information on a "limited number" of accounts.
The social-engineering attack was bent on stealing employee credentials, the company said, calling the as-yet-unidentified adversary "well-organized" and "methodical
articles.title: Twilio Suffers Data Breach After Employees Fall Victim to SMS Phishing Attack

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
The U.S. Treasury Department on Monday placed sanctions against crypto mixing service Tornado Cash, citing its use by the North Korea-backed Lazarus Group in the high-profile hacks of Ethereum bridges to launder and cash out the ill-gotten money.
Tornado Cash, which allows users to move cryptocurrency assets between accounts by obfuscating their origin and destination, is estimated to have been
articles.title: U.S. Sanctions Virtual Currency Mixer Tornado Cash for Alleged Use in Laundering

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
In what's yet another instance of malicious packages creeping into public code repositories, 10 modules have been removed from the Python Package Index (PyPI) for their ability to harvest critical data points such as passwords and Api tokens.
The packages "install info-stealers that enable attackers to steal developer's private data and personal credentials," Israeli cybersecurity firm Check
articles.title: 10 Credential Stealing Python Libraries Found on PyPI Repository

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (The Hacker News)
articles.description:
TL;DR: As weird as it might sound, seeing a few false positives reported by a security scanner is probably a good sign and certainly better than seeing none. Let's explain why.
Introduction
False positives have made a somewhat unexpected appearance in our lives in recent years. I am, of course, referring to the COVID-19 pandemic, which required massive testing campaigns in order to control the
articles.title: The Truth About False Positives in Security

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Over a dozen military-industrial complex enterprises and public institutions in Afghanistan and Europe have come under a wave of targeted attacks since January 2022 to steal confidential data by simultaneously making use of six different backdoors.
Russian cybersecurity firm Kaspersky attributed the attacks "with a high degree of confidence" to a China-linked threat actor tracked by Proofpoint
articles.title: Chinese Hackers Targeted Dozens of Industrial Enterprises and Public Institutions

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
A new botnet named Orchard has been observed using Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto's account transaction information to generate domain names to conceal its command-and-control (C2) infrastructure.
"Because of the uncertainty of Bitcoin transactions, this technique is more unpredictable than using the common time-generated [domain generation algorithms], and thus more difficult to defend
articles.title: New Orchard Botnet Uses Bitcoin Founder’s Account Info to Generate Malicious Domains

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (The Hacker News)
articles.description:
A few days ago, a friend and I were having a rather engaging conversation that sparked my excitement. We were discussing my prospects of becoming a red teamer as a natural career progression. The reason I got stirred up is not that I want to change either my job or my position, as I am a happy camper being part of Cymulate's blue team.
What upset me was that my friend could not grasp the idea
articles.title: The Benefits of Building a Mature and Diverse Blue Team

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
A sophisticated scam-as-a-service operation dubbed Classiscam has now infiltrated into Singapore, more than 1.5 years after expanding to Europe.
"Scammers posing as legitimate buyers approach sellers with the request to purchase goods from their listings and the ultimate aim of stealing payment data," Group-IB said in a report shared with The Hacker News.
The cybersecurity firm called the
articles.title: Researchers Uncover Classiscam Scam-as-a-Service Operations in Singapore

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Facebook parent company Meta disclosed that it took action against two espionage operations in South Asia that leveraged its social media platforms to distribute malware to potential targets.
The first set of activities is what the company described as "persistent and well-resourced" and undertaken by a hacking group tracked under the moniker Bitter APT (aka APT-C-08 or T-APT-17) targeting
articles.title: Meta Cracks Down on Cyber Espionage Operations in South Asia Abusing Facebook

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
A new IoT botnet malware dubbed RapperBot has been observed rapidly evolving its capabilities since it was first discovered in mid-June 2022.
"This family borrows heavily from the original Mirai source code, but what separates it from other IoT malware families is its built-in capability to brute force credentials and gain access to SSH servers instead of Telnet as implemented in Mirai,"
articles.title: New IoT RapperBot Malware Targeting Linux Servers via SSH Brute-Forcing Attack

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Twitter on Friday revealed that a now-patched zero-day bug was used to link phone numbers and emails to user accounts on the social media platform.
"As a result of the vulnerability, if someone submitted an email address or phone number to Twitter's systems, Twitter's systems would tell the person what Twitter account the submitted email addresses or phone number was associated with, if any,"
articles.title: Hackers Exploit Twitter Vulnerability to Exposes 5.4 Million Accounts

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
Slack said it took the step of resetting passwords for about 0.5% of its users after a flaw exposed salted password hashes when creating or revoking shared invitation links for workspaces.
"When a user performed either of these actions, Slack transmitted a hashed version of their password to other workspace members," the enterprise communication and collaboration platform said in an alert on 4th
articles.title: Slack Resets Passwords After a Bug Exposed Hashed Passwords for Some Users

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
A threat actor working to further Iranian goals is said to have been behind a set of disruptive cyberattacks against Albanian government services in mid-July 2022.
Cybersecurity firm Mandiant said the malicious activity against a NATO state represented a "geographic expansion of Iranian disruptive cyber operations."
The July 17 attacks, according to Albania's National Agency of Information
articles.title: Iranian Hackers likely Behind Disruptive Cyberattacks Against Albanian Government

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (The Hacker News)
articles.description:
Conflicting business requirements is a common problem – and you find it in every corner of an organization, including in information technology. Resolving these conflicts is a must, but it isn’t always easy – though sometimes there is a novel solution that helps.
In IT management there is a constant struggle between security and operations teams. Yes, both teams ultimately want to have secure
articles.title: Resolving Availability vs. Security, a Constant Conflict in IT

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ravie Lakshmanan)
articles.description:
The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has warned of critical security vulnerabilities in Emergency Alert System (EAS) encoder/decoder devices.
If left unpatched, the issues could allow an adversary to issue fraudulent emergency alerts over TV, radio, and cable networks.
The August 1 advisory comes courtesy of DHS' Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). CYBIR security researcher Ken
articles.title: Emergency Alert System Flaws Could Let Attackers Transmit Fake Messages

articles.title: Hackers Use Evilnum Malware to Target Cryptocurrency and Commodities Platforms

articles.description: Typically, when threat actors look to infiltrate an organization's SaaS apps, they look to SaaS app misconfigurations as a means of entry. articles.title: The New Weak Link in SaaS Security: Devices

The recovery of the bitcoin ransoms
articles.title: FBI Seizes $500,000 Ransomware Payments and Crypto from North Korean Hackers

articles.title: Atlassian Rolls Out Security Patch for Critical Confluence Vulnerability

articles.title: Cynomi Automated Virtual CISO (vCISO) Platform for Service Providers

articles.title: Apple Releases Security Patches for all Devices Fixing Dozens of New Vulnerabilities

articles.title: Cisco Releases Patches for Critical Flaws Impacting Nexus Dashboard for Data Centers

articles.title: New Rust-based Ransomware Family Targets Windows, Linux, and ESXi Systems

articles.title: Google Adds Support for DNS-over-HTTP/3 in Android to Keep DNS Queries Private

articles.title: Unpatched GPS Tracker Bugs Could Let Attackers Disrupt Vehicles Remotely

articles.title: Russian Hackers Using DropBox and Google Drive to Drop Malicious Payloads

articles.title: New Air-Gap Attack Uses SATA Cable as an Antenna to Transfer Radio Signals

articles.title: Several New Play Store Apps Spotted Distributing Joker, Facestealer and Coper Malware

articles.title: Hackers Distributing Password Cracking Tool for PLCs and HMIs to Target Industrial Systems
